title: Kelshi Beach
subtitle: A Serene Hidden Gem on the Konkan Coast
overview: Kelshi Beach, located in the Ratnagiri district of Maharashtra, is a peaceful and pristine coastal village on the Konkan shoreline. Known for its untouched natural beauty, black-sand shores, and calm atmosphere, it’s an ideal escape for solitude seekers and nature enthusiasts.
The beach stretches for nearly 2.5 km and is bordered by sand dunes, lush coconut groves, and the Peshwa-era Yakub Baba Dargah, making it both scenic and spiritual.
With minimal commercialization, Kelshi offers a true glimpse into rural coastal Maharashtra and is perfect for long beach walks, birdwatching, and exploring nearby heritage spots.

highlights.title: Secluded & Peaceful
highlights.description: Less crowded and ideal for those who wish to relax away from commercial beach noise.

highlights.title: Yakub Baba Dargah
highlights.description: A revered shrine located near the beach, visited by both locals and travelers.

highlights.title: Birdwatching Spot
highlights.description: Kelshi attracts migratory birds, especially during winter months.

geography.intro: Kelshi is a small coastal village located around 35 km from Dapoli in Ratnagiri district, along the northern Konkan coastline.

details.label: Landscape
details.value: Black sand, dunes, and coconut groves

climate.description: Kelshi experiences a tropical coastal climate with pleasant winters, hot summers, and lush green monsoons.

seasons.text: Best time to visit: November to March
Avoid monsoon season (June–September) due to rough seas

geography.conclusion: Its calm weather and quiet surroundings make Kelshi ideal for short weekend retreats and spiritual exploration.

activities.title: Long Beach Walks
activities.description: Enjoy walking along the expansive sandy stretch surrounded by coconut trees and dunes.
info: Perfect during early mornings or sunset
Minimal crowd ensures a peaceful atmosphere

activities.title: Birdwatching
activities.description: Spot a variety of migratory and coastal birds along the shoreline and nearby creek.
info: Bring binoculars for a better experience

activities.title: Visit Yakub Baba Dargah
activities.description: A centuries-old shrine of Yakub Baba built during the Peshwa period near the dunes.
info: Located a short walk from the main beach

activities.title: Fishing & Local Life
activities.description: Witness the daily lives of local fishermen and their traditional wooden boats.
info: Fresh seafood available in nearby homestays

attractions.title: Kelshi Sand Dunes
attractions.description: Natural formations of sand created by years of tidal activity — a must-see geological feature.

attractions.title: Harnai Fort
attractions.description: A coastal fort located about 30 km from Kelshi, offering sea views and Maratha history.

marineLife.intro: Kelshi’s nearshore ecosystem supports small fish, crabs, and a variety of coastal plants and shells.

items.title: Fish & Crustaceans
items.description: Small fish and crabs can be seen along the shallow waters and rocky edges.

items.title: Shell & Coral Fragments
items.description: Tide pools often reveal small coral fragments and unique seashells.

conclusion: Kelshi’s marine ecosystem remains largely undisturbed due to low tourism activity.
Visitors are encouraged to avoid littering and respect local ecology.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Kelshi is around 35 km from Dapoli and 200 km from Pune via Mandangad.
Buses and private vehicles are available from Dapoli and Mumbai.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Khed (70 km away).
From Khed, local taxis and buses connect to Kelshi village.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airport: Ratnagiri (130 km) or Pune (200 km).
Private cabs available for the onward journey.

gallery.alt: Yakub Baba Dargah near the dunes

bookingTips.description: Stay in local homestays to experience true Konkan hospitality.
Try homemade seafood thali and fresh coconut water.
Carry cash as digital payments may not be available everywhere.
